text: How to insert arrays into a database?
In my previous question a lot of users wanted me to give some more data to toy with.
So I got working on exporting all my data and processing it with Python, but then I realized: where do I leave all this data?
Well I decided the best thing would be to stick them in a database, so at least I don't have to parse the raw files every time.
But since I know nothing about databases this is turning out to be quite confusing.
I tried some tutorials to create a sqlite database, add a table and field and try to insert my numpy.arrays, but it can't get it to work.
Typically my results per dog look like this:
So I have 35 different dogs and each dog has 24 measurement.
Each measurement itself has an unknown amount of contacts.
Each measurement consists out of a 3D array (248 frames of the whole plate [255x63]) and a 2D array (the maximal values for each sensor of the plate [255x63]).
Storing one value in a database wasn't a problem, but getting my 2D arrays in there didn't seem to work.
So my question is how should I order this in a database and insert my arrays into it?
